org.threadly.litesockets

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TCPClient, UDPClient

    public abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

    This is the base Client object for client communication. Anything that reads or writes data will use this object. The clients work by having buffered reads and writes for the socket. They tell the SocketExecuter when a read can be added or a write is ready for the socket.

    All reads are issued on a callback on a Reader in a single threaded manor. All writes will be sent in the order they are received. In general its better to write full protocol parsable packets with each write where possible. If not possible your own locking/ordering will have to be ensured. Close events will happen on there own Closer callback but it uses the same ThreadKey as the Reader thread. All Reads should be received before a close event happens.

    The client object can not function with out being in a SocketExecuter. Writes can be added before its put in the executer, but it will not write to the socket until added to the executer.

      Used to notify when a Client there is data to Read for a Client.

    • Method Detail

      • getRemoteSocketAddress

        public abstract java.net.SocketAddress getRemoteSocketAddress()
        Returns:
        the remote SocketAddress this client is connected to.

      • getLocalSocketAddress

        public abstract java.net.SocketAddress getLocalSocketAddress()
        Returns:
        the local SocketAddress this client is using.

      • canWrite

        public abstract boolean canWrite()
        Returns true if this client has data pending in its write buffers. False if there is no data pending write.
        Returns:
        true if data is pending write, false if there is no data to write.

      • clientOptions

        public abstract Client.ClientOptions clientOptions()
        This allows you to set/get client options for this client connection. Not all options can be set for every client.
        Returns:
        a Client.ClientOptions object to set/get options for this client.

      • connect

        public abstract org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> connect()

        Called to connect this client to a host. This is done non-blocking.

        If there is an error connecting close() will also be called on the client.

        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that will complete when the socket is connected, or fail if we can't connect.

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public abstract void setConnectionTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the connection timeout value for this client. This must be called before connect() has called on this client.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the time in milliseconds to wait for the client to connect.

      • hasConnectionTimedOut

        public abstract boolean hasConnectionTimedOut()

        This tells us if the client has timed out before it has been connected to the socket. If the client has connected fully this will return false from that point on (even on a closed connection).

        Returns:
        false if the client has been connected, true if it has not connected and the timeout limit has been reached.

      • getTimeout

        public abstract int getTimeout()

        Used to get this clients connection timeout information.

        Returns:
        the max amount of time to wait for a connection to connect on this socket.

      • getWriteBufferSize

        public abstract int getWriteBufferSize()

        This is used to get the current size of the unWriten writeBuffer.

        Returns:
        the current size of the writeBuffer.

      • getProtocol

        public abstract WireProtocol getProtocol()

        This is used by the SocketExecuter to help understand how to manage this client. Currently only UDP and TCP exist.

        Returns:
        The IP protocol type of this client.

      • write

        public abstract org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<?> write(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)

        This is called to write data to the clients socket. Its important to note that there is no back pressure when adding writes so care should be taken to now allow the clients getWriteBufferSize() to get to big.

        Parameters:
        bb - The ByteBuffer to write onto the clients socket.
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that will be completed once the data has been fully written to the socket.

      • write

        public abstract org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<?> write(MergedByteBuffers mbb)

        This is called to write data to the clients socket. Its important to note that there is no back pressure when adding writes so care should be taken to now allow the clients getWriteBufferSize() to get to big.

        Parameters:
        mbb - The MergedByteBuffers to write onto the clients socket.
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that will be completed once the data has been fully written to the socket.

      • lastWriteFuture

        public abstract org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<?> lastWriteFuture()

      • close

        public void close()

        Closes this client. Reads can still occur after this it called. Client.ClientCloseListener.onClose(Client) will still be called (if set) once all reads are done.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • close

        public abstract void close(java.lang.Throwable error)

        Closes this client. Reads can still occur after this it called. Client.ClientCloseListener.onClose(Client) will still be called (if set) once all reads are done.

        Parameters:
        error - The error that resulted in us closing this client, or null if closing normally

      • canRead

        public boolean canRead()
        Returns true if this client can have reads added to it or false if its read buffers are full.
        Returns:
        true if more reads can be added, false if not.

      • getReadBufferSize

        public int getReadBufferSize()

        This is used to get the current size of the readBuffers pending reads.

        Returns:
        the current size of the ReadBuffer.

      • getClientsThreadExecutor

        public org.threadly.concurrent.SubmitterExecutor getClientsThreadExecutor()

        This returns this clients SubmitterExecutor.

        Its worth noting that operations done on this SubmitterExecutor can/will block Read callbacks on the client, but it does provide you the ability to execute things on the clients read thread.

        Returns:
        The SubmitterExecutor for the client.

      • getClientsSocketExecuter

        public SocketExecuter getClientsSocketExecuter()

        This is used to get the clients SocketExecuter.

        Returns:
        the SocketExecuter set for this client. if none, null is returned.

      • addCloseListener

        public void addCloseListener(Client.ClientCloseListener closer)

        This adds a Client.ClientCloseListener for this client. Once set the client will call .onClose on it once it a socket close is detected.

        Parameters:
        closer - sets this clients Client.ClientCloseListener callback.

      • setReader

        public void setReader(Client.Reader reader)

        This sets the Reader for the client. Once set data received on the socket will be callback on this Reader to be processed. If no reader is set before connecting the client read data will just queue up till we hit the the max buffer size

        Parameters:
        reader - the Client.Reader callback to set for this client.

      • getRead

        public ReuseableMergedByteBuffers getRead()

        Whenever a the Client.Reader Interfaces Client.Reader.onRead(Client) is called the getRead() should be called from the client.

        Returns:
        a ReuseableMergedByteBuffers of the current read data for this client.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()

        Returns if this client is closed or not. Once a client is marked closed there is no way to reOpen it. You must just make a new client. Just because this returns false does not mean the client is connected. Before a client connects, but has not yet closed this will be false.

        Returns:
        true if the client is closed, false if the client has not yet been closed.

      • getStats

        public SimpleByteStats getStats()
        Returns the SimpleByteStats for this client.
        Returns:
        the byte stats for this client.

      • setStatsEnabled

        public void setStatsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Can be invoked with false to disable stat collection on client. This can reduce minor memory and performance overheads.
        Parameters:
        enabled - false to disable stat collection, or true to enable / reset stats
